Package io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost

Interface MarkovStateModel

All Superinterfaces:
DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>, InHostConfiguration, Serializable
@Immutable public interface MarkovStateModel extends InHostConfiguration, DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>
Configuration for an in‑host Markov state model.

This interface describes the distributions and parameters used by the simplistic in‑host Markov model implementation. It supplies distributions for incubation, infectious and symptom durations, and for the immune waning half‑life. Implementations are primarily consumed by the initialiser and state classes that set up and manage an individual's in‑host state.

Downstream uses include the initialisers and builders such as DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser, DefaultPersonInitialiser and DefaultInHostPhenomenologicalStateInitialiser. It is also referenced by example and test code such as Experiment.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT

      static final io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.ImmutableMarkovStateModel DEFAULT
      A sensible default parameterisation of the Markov model.

      This instance provides a small set of log‑normal distributions used as a baseline in examples and tests. Downstream callers that rely on a simple default include Experiment.

      See Also:
      • DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser

  • Method Details

    • getImmuneWaningHalfLife

      Distribution getImmuneWaningHalfLife()
      Distribution for the half life of waning immunity.

      This distribution describes the expected time scale for immune waning and is sampled when determining the decay of immunity after recovery or vaccination. It is consulted by initialisers and state updaters. The distribution is not age specific in this model but may be modified by DemographicAdjustment.Markov implementations that provide age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in the form of an odds ratio.

      Specified by:
      getImmuneWaningHalfLife in interface DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>
      Returns:
      a Distribution representing the immune waning half life

    • getIncubationPeriod

      Distribution getIncubationPeriod()
      Distribution for the incubation period (time from infection to onset).

      This distribution is sampled by initialisers such as DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser and by phenomenological initialisers when converting to internal state durations. It is not age specific in this model but may be modified by DemographicAdjustment.Markov implementations that provide age‑specific adjustments to the incubation period distribution in the form of a odds ratio.

      Specified by:
      getIncubationPeriod in interface DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>
      Returns:
      a Distribution used to sample incubation periods

    • getInfectiousDuration

      Distribution getInfectiousDuration()
      Distribution for the infectious duration.

      This value is not age specific in the current model. Callers include the default initialiser which samples an infectious duration for each infected individual. The distribution is not age specific in this model but may be modified by DemographicAdjustment.Markov implementations that provide age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in the form of an odds ratio.

      Specified by:
      getInfectiousDuration in interface DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>
      Returns:
      a Distribution for infectious duration

    • getSeverityFatalityCutoff

      default double getSeverityFatalityCutoff(Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration)
      Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed as fatal.

      The default implementation derives the cutoff from the ExecutionConfiguration.getInfectionFatalityRate() as 1 minus the fatality rate. This is used when mapping severity to death outcomes in the outbreak and state logic.

      Specified by:
      getSeverityFatalityCutoff in interface InHostConfiguration
      Parameters:
      outbreak - the current outbreak context
      configuration - the execution configuration providing fatality rates
      Returns:
      the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify fatality

    • getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff

      default double getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff(Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration)
      Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed as hospitalised.

      The default implementation derives the cutoff from the ExecutionConfiguration.getInfectionHospitalisationRate() as 1 minus the hospitalisation rate. Downstream uses include the same baseline and state classes that interpret severity measures.

      Specified by:
      getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff in interface InHostConfiguration
      Parameters:
      outbreak - the current outbreak context
      configuration - the execution configuration providing hospitalisation rates
      Returns:
      the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify hospitalisation

    • getSeveritySymptomsCutoff

      default double getSeveritySymptomsCutoff(Outbreak outbreak, ExecutionConfiguration configuration)
      Severity cutoff used to decide whether an infected individual is classed as a symptomatic case.

      The default implementation derives the cutoff from the ExecutionConfiguration.getInfectionCaseRate() as 1 minus the case rate. This method is used by classes such as OutbreakBaseline, PersonState and DefaultOutbreakBaseliner to map a continuous severity measure to discrete outcomes.

      Specified by:
      getSeveritySymptomsCutoff in interface InHostConfiguration
      Parameters:
      outbreak - the current outbreak context
      configuration - the execution configuration providing attack rates
      Returns:
      the cutoff in the unit interval [0,1] used to classify symptoms

    • getSymptomDuration

      Distribution getSymptomDuration()
      Distribution for the duration of symptoms.

      Used by initialisers to determine how long symptomatic states last. The distribution is not age specific in this model but may be modified by DemographicAdjustment.Markov implementations that provide age‑specific adjustments to the symptom duration distribution in the form of an odds ratio.

      Specified by:
      getSymptomDuration in interface DemographicAdjustment.Markov<Distribution,Double>
      Returns:
      a Distribution for symptom duration
